sentences.en: " This is a strange remark,'said she, " and apropos de bottes. "
sentences.cn: “ 这是种怪论, ” 她说, “ 而且前后所说毫无关联. ”

sentences.en: All my suggestions apropos the script were accepted.
sentences.cn: 我所有有关该剧本的建议均被采纳了。

sentences.en: Apropos Dudley Moore living in California he said, "He loves the space, Californians have a lot of space."
sentences.cn: 提到住在加利福尼亚的达德利·穆尔，他说：“他喜欢开阔，加利福尼亚人的生活空间非常开阔。”

sentences.en: Apropos my colleague's previous question about the Concorde Agreement.
sentences.cn: 关于我的同行问的那个协和协议的问题.

sentences.en: Apropos of closing night, we almost had a crisis.
sentences.cn: 演出的最后一晚, 我们几乎遭遇到一场危机.

sentences.en: Apropos, I have something to tell you.
sentences.cn: 顺便, 我有点事跟你说.

sentences.en: George Orwell once asked, apropos of publishers, "Why don't they just say, "We don't want your poems"?"
sentences.cn: 乔治·奥威尔一次提及出版商时曾问道：“为什么他们不干脆说，‘我们不想要你的诗作’？”

sentences.en: He had nothing to say apropos of the latest developments.
sentences.cn: 至于最新的进展，他没有什么要说的。

sentences.en: His suggestion is very much apropos.
I thought he spoke very apropos.
It was a verse from the book of Job. It was so apropos.
sentences.cn: 这是摘自乔布书中的一句诗，用得非常恰当。

sentences.en: Mr Green went to see Mr White apropos of buying a house.
sentences.cn: 关于买房子的事,格林先生去找怀特先生去了.
船只失事总是来得出人意料.

sentences.en: You'll find the last paragraph extremely apropos.
sentences.cn: 你会觉得最后一段文字极为中肯.

trans.tran_cn: 适当的)； 有关(with reference to； regarding)
